svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - September 8 2019

title: "Week in Ethereum News
September 8, 2019" date: "2019-09-09"
Eth News and Links
Eth1
‚Ä¢ Geth v1.9.3 - maintenance release with Istanbul upgrade finalized
‚Ä¢ Least Authority‚Äôs ProgPow security audit , later discussed on core devs call. ‚ÄúWe found no major
issues and the design appears to function as intended.‚Äù
‚Ä¢ First call for the finality gadget working group that will use the eth2 chain to finalize the eth1
chain and then drastically reduce mining rewards.
‚Ä¢ Latest core devs call . Live tweeted notes . Oct 2 testnet fork, mainnet in Nov. Lots of blake2b
discussion . Next hard fork after this one named ‚ÄúBerlin.‚Äù
Eth2
‚Ä¢ A Casper FFG explainer . How it adapts PBFT
‚Ä¢ It‚Äôs Eth2 networking lockin week
‚Ä¢ Games for evaluating liveness in Casper CBC
‚Ä¢ Bouncing attack analysis and prevention
‚Ä¢ Lighthouse client update - interop with Nimbus, networking to official spec, 50ms slot times with 8
validators
‚Ä¢ Prysmatic client update - like Lighthouse, prepping for Eth2 networking lockin
Layer 2
‚Ä¢ Vitalik: layer 1 techniques on layer 2
‚Ä¢ A gentle guide to the OVM , and where CEL is building.
‚Ä¢ Latest Plasma implementer call
‚Ä¢ IACR paper on lightweight watchtowers
Stuff for developers
‚Ä¢ Eth2 developer experience survey
‚Ä¢ Write your first zk snark using Iden3‚Äôs circom and snarkjs libraries
‚Ä¢ babyJubJub in Rust
‚Ä¢ Groth16 verifier
‚Ä¢ Zac Williamson video on PLONK , Aztec‚Äôs new snark construction
‚Ä¢ Remix IDE v0.8.6
‚Ä¢ web3Connect v1.0.0-beta.20 - 92% smaller bundle size, some breaking changes
‚Ä¢ Chainshot‚Äôs intro to ethers.js tutorial
‚Ä¢ filestorage.js for storage on SKALE sidechains
‚Ä¢ First time Eth developing on Windows guide
‚Ä¢ Build a text notification app with IPFS, Twilio and Eth address for authentication
‚Ä¢ Runtime Verification announces work on bounded model checker , a symbolic execution tool as a
component of K‚Äôs Haskell backend.
‚Ä¢ Stop using Solidity‚Äôs transfer . Christian Reitwie√üner‚Äôs response : ‚ÄúWe have not yet reached a
conclusion on that‚Äù
Ecosystem
‚Ä¢ Mixers and beyond: Semaphore and the MicroMix eth and token mixer (live on Kovan testnet). An
outline on making a private DAO with Semaphore
‚Ä¢ State of mixers - a report on the tradeoffs and progresses of mixers in our ecosystem
‚Ä¢ Mixicles - Juels, Breidenbach, et al paper with Chainlink. Input payments and decide payouts based
on oracle results. two or more parties and yield payouts that are conditioned on oracle reports.
‚Ä¢ A coin mixer built on Enigma
‚Ä¢ Evolution of Dharma - engaging chronicle of how Dharma has navigated the idea maze
‚Ä¢ EthBoston submissions and winners . Also two great videos from EthBoston to watch: Albert Ni‚Äôs ‚Äú
Ethereum from multiple perspectives ‚Äù and Raul Jordan‚Äôs ‚Äú Paving the path for the future of Ethereum ‚Äù
Standards and governance topics
‚Ä¢ The LAO : an LLC+TheDAO mashup to be a US-compliant DAO for profit. Ross Campbell‚Äôs code for how
TheLAO extends Moloch
‚Ä¢ Since everyone is launching a DAO: how to launch a (moloch fork) DAO
‚Ä¢ ERC2258 : Custodial ownership standard
Application layer
‚Ä¢ Maker‚Äôs oracles v2 : 0x, dYdX, Set, Gnosis to be oracles and get fees. Also Dai Stability Fee now at
‚Ä¢ DeFi Saver: automatic CDP liquidation protection
‚Ä¢ pooltogether v2 is live
‚Ä¢ PoolDai also live: donate the interest from your cDai to a good cause
‚Ä¢ With any DeFi product, you should be aware of what risks you‚Äôre taking. Ameen writes up the risks to
using Compound . Compound CEO Leshner‚Äôs response .
‚Ä¢ More money markets: Outlet , a wallet aiming to abstract away using the protocols using Plaid as the
fiat onramp
‚Ä¢ Podcrypt : podcast discovery webapp with recurring Eth donations
‚Ä¢ Majority Report : cataloging Augur‚Äôs decisions by REP holders, ie LexisNexis/WestLaw for Augur.
‚Ä¢ A text based RPG/MUD
‚Ä¢ Decentraland gets first casino
‚Ä¢ Austin Griffith‚Äôs latest DAOG version: Three Queens
‚Ä¢ Guesser markets are competitive for NFL games
‚Ä¢ SingularDTV ‚Äôs SNGLS DAO to incentivize content curation
‚Ä¢ Gitcoin hits 2m GMV
Tokens / Business / Regulation
‚Ä¢ Joel Monegro: Ethereum and the 77 dwarfs . Nobody in blockchain ever got fired for choosing to build
on Ethereum.
‚Ä¢ Information asymmetry in crypto . web3 moves fast, some aren‚Äôt keeping up.
‚Ä¢ Mougayar‚Äôs PIB framework for comparing crypto tokens
‚Ä¢ Paxos launches a gold-backed token that takes a fee at the contract layer on transfer. It‚Äôll be
interesting to see if this gets wrapped
‚Ä¢ Dan Robinson‚Äôs yTokens idea , collateralized fixed-term lending. Zero coupon bonds for a yield
curve.
General
‚Ä¢ ‚Äú ETH goes where no Bitcoin has gone before ‚Äù - William Shatner
‚Ä¢ 80k Hours Podcast talks to Vitalik for a few hours (with transcript!). Lots of ‚Äúwhat are blockchains
good for‚Äù conversation.
‚Ä¢ China‚Äôs digital currency , in the works for 5 years, will be somewhat similar to Libra
‚Ä¢ LedgerLive finally supports ERC20 tokens
‚Ä¢ Eric Wall says no to Hedera/Hashgraph /whatever it‚Äôs called. Followup .
‚Ä¢ Missed this back then: in June, Jeffrey Berns closed the deal to buy Kirkwood Bank of Nevada . So we
should get another crypto-friendly bank, as promised at Devcon.
‚Ä¢ For the 2nd straight week, I did an annotated version of the newsletter. Anyone who has bought the
NFT can read it. Same link, you can still buy the NFT. See immediately below:
üéÇ¬†3 year anniversary¬†üéÇ
Just to repeat the advertisement immediately above: you can buy the limited edition NFT for 0.11 Eth
which will unlock the annotated edition.
All proceeds will be back into Ethereum somehow, likely donated to a public good, at my discretion.
And who knows, maybe there will be future benefits for the 200 NFT holders?
Dates of Note
Upcoming¬†dates of note (new in bold ) :
‚Ä¢ Sep 9-Oct 21 - Kyber DeFi virtual hackathon
‚Ä¢ Sep 10-11 - DeFi Summit (London)
‚Ä¢ Sep 15 - Augur v1 cutoff
‚Ä¢ Sep 15 - Ethereal Tel Aviv
‚Ä¢ Sep 16 - Tachyon accelerator application deadline
‚Ä¢ Sep 15-16- StarkWare sessions (Tel Aviv)
‚Ä¢ Sep 27 - ErasureCon (password: information) (SF)
‚Ä¢ Oct 7 - ENS workshop (Osaka)
‚Ä¢ Oct 8-11 - DeVcon (Osaka)¬†and Devcon social events calendar
‚Ä¢ Oct 19-20 - Crosslink (Taipei)
‚Ä¢ Nov 5-6 - Decentralized insurance D1Conf (Malta)
‚Ä¢ Nov 8-10 - ETHWaterloo
If you appreciate this newsletter, thank ConsenSys
This newsletter is made possible by ConsenSys .
I own 100% Week In Ethereum. Editorial control has always been me.
If you‚Äôre wondering ‚Äú why didn‚Äôt my post make it into Week in Ethereum ,‚Äù then here‚Äôs a hint: don‚Äôt
email me. Do put it on Reddit. It‚Äôs amazing to me how many people email me when every issue has a link
at the bottom saying not to email me to get in the newsletter.
If you're unhappy with editorial decisions or anything that I have written in this issue, feel free to
tweet at me .
This headline stays as long as so many people continue to link to old URL and not the right one:
weekinethereumnews.com
Archive on the web if you‚Äôre linking to it:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-september-8-2019/
Follow me on Twitter , because most of what is linked here gets tweeted first: @evan_van_ness
Did you get forwarded this newsletter? Sign up to receive the weekly email
